themes: equity and inclusion for marginalized groups
transparency and clarity in application process
barriers for small and emerging organizations
streamlining and fairness in funding distribution
key_phrases: hard for smaller organizations, emerging artists, or groups led by BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and disabled creatives to access these resources
intentional outreach to communities that don’t already have connections or development teams
application process itself also needs to be demystified
clearer guidelines, more accessible language, and hands-on education
funding options included more general operating support, not just project-based grants
process should be streamlined and fair
support should also be more evenly distributed across different disciplines and neighborhoods
funding process needs to reflect that by being more accessible, more representative, and more aligned with the real needs
barriers_identified: hard for smaller organizations, emerging artists, or groups led by BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and disabled creatives to access these resources
communities that don’t already have connections or development teams in place
application process needs to be demystified
solutions_proposed: intentional outreach to communities that don’t already have connections or development teams
clearer guidelines, more accessible language, and hands-on education around how to apply
funding options included more general operating support, not just project-based grants
process should be streamlined and fair
support should also be more evenly distributed across different disciplines and neighborhoods
